intro: Timonius merokensis, commonly known as the Merokens bellflower, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and thrives in cool, moist environments with well-drained soil. Its conservation status is critically endangered due to habitat loss and climate change. Researchers study it for its potential medicinal properties and genetic diversity.
